title: Low priority queue and leave buster
body:
I understand the need to punish players who afk and leave during a game but why is it necessary to punish players who "leave" the game from remake?

During the past patch I've had trouble connecting to the servers when loading into the game. Sometimes it would take an absurdly long time, and sometimes I wouldn't even get to connect before my team remakes the game. Leaver buster than would then punish me with a 5 minute low priority queue before I can try and even test to see if my connection was stable. Custom games work fine for me by the way so no, I cannot test my connection through a custom game. Then when I am finally able to see if my connection was finally stable, I am punished with a longer queue time because the issue has still not been fixed. 

TL:DR I don't see why players are being punished for a remake when the impact is much less on players than a player who afks during game.

Update: Got hit with the 20minute low priority queue. How do I even play this game?

Update2: I loaded to 100% and then crashed. Sometimes it tells me to check my internet connection but it works fine for everything else. I just want to play. 

Update3: Still don't know whats wrong but after 13 minutes I've finally connected. We won the game.

replies.body:
Disconnecting from a match, even if not intentional, will negatively impact all players in the match. This is why both Leaverbuster and /Remake treat all disconnections equally and will take action against accounts that have a trend if disconnecting from matches. This is also a key reason why low priority queue penalties cannot be modified or removed in any way. Check out our [/Remake FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/208754686--Remake-FAQ) for additional details on this system.

It sounds like your connection to the servers is unstable, which would be why you're having trouble connecting and seeing crashes. Our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) is a good place to start in troubleshooting this issue and will take you through the most common solutions for the issues you're seeing.

If you still have these issues after working through the guide, please let me know.
